subject: Inclusion of Utility Shifting works in the RFPs/Bids as part of Civil Construction under Hybrid Annuity and EPC mode -reg.
text: Ia welv <TTHTf xifedrut 7414 / Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (Tgv 4ar7 a {rjtrf T14) W7H / Fax : 91-11-25093507 25093514 M1 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) v-5  6, #aer-10 , ERO5T, 78 ferlt-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 NHAIPolicy Guidelines/Utility Shifting/2020 No. 7.2.8/2020 dated 06 March, 2020 (Decision taken on Agenda Item no. 415.11 in 415th Authority's Meeting held on 03.03.2020) Sub: Inclusion of  Utility Shifting works in the RFPsIBids as part of Civil Construction under Hybrid Annuity and EPC Mode reg: 1 As per   existing   provisions for  shifting of  obstructing utilities in  Hybrid Annuity and EPC mode contracts; the concessionaire/contractor undertakes shifting of utilities such as electrical lines and water pipe lines and cost of such shifting is borne by the Authority/NHAI. 2_ It has been observed that there is unusual delay in the process of obtaining estimates from utility owning agencies and sanction of the same at the level of respective competent authorities in NHAI causing delay in the execution of shifting of utilities. the concessionaire/contractor is at the SOR rate for scheduled items and market rate for non-scheduled items which cannot be termed as execution of works at competitive rates. In  addition, there are issues of incorrect provisioning of quantum and rates of items taken in the estimates by the utility owning agencies and upgradation of facilities which further compound the problem affecting expedient approval and consequent execution. 3. In order to tide over the above deficiencies, it has been decided to include the items of utility shifting in the scope of work while inviting bids: This should serve the twin objective of market/ competitive   discovery of rates of utility shifting works and reduce delays in the execution of such utility shifting: 4 Following guidelines are issued in this regard:  4.1 The scope of work and estimated cost of   shifting of utilities (excluding the supervision charges which and without credit of dismantled Iscrap material) shall be included in the bids under civil construction cost as per the detailed estimates in compliance with check list issue vide NHAI HQ letter dated NHAI/11012/Gen /Utility/ 2017/108225 dated 07.11.2017 duly reviewed /verified by the DPR consultant and sanctioned by the utility agencies at the appropriate level. ROs/ PDs would ensure that the DPR consultants have checked/verified the estimates before sanction by utility owning agencies broadly on following points:  (i)   Utility shifting plans would show the existing utilities to be shifted and the proposed utilities with offsets, development plan of project highway duly dimensioned and Proposed Right of (ii) There should be no variation in the quantum of existing utilities to be shifted and new facilities to be provided except where the variation is R & W} NHAI paid Also Way.
